backend

Class Tickets

  • java.lang.Object
    • backend.File
      • backend.event.Tickets

  • public class Tickets
extends Data
    This class represents a AvailableTickets file, in memory. It is responsible for controlling all access to ticket and event information. It contains methods that add new tickets and remove tickets. All accesses are validated and errors are reported to caller.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description

      an iterator of the event list
      java.util.List<Event> events
      a list of Events that represents the AvailableTickets file
      private boolean reset
      a boolean that represents if the Iterator needs to be reset should only be called once in encode.

        default Constructor for Tickets class. Primarily used for testing purposes

      • Tickets

        public Tickets(java.lang.String readFileName,
       java.lang.String writeFilename)
        Constructor for xstreambackend.Tickets class. Calls super class xstreambackend.Data to set filenames.
        Parameters:
        readFileName - a string representing the path of the existing AvailableTickets file to be read in.
        writeFilename - a string representing the path of the new AvailableTickets

    • Method Detail

      • getEvent

        public Event getEvent(java.lang.String title,
             java.lang.String seller)
        This method is responsible for retrieving a event from the map of event searching the events map for events that the seller has tickets for then by the event name.
        Parameters:
        title - a string that represents the name of the xstreambackend.Event
        seller - a string that represents the name of seller
        Returns:
        an object that represents a ticket for an event.

      • newEvent

        public int newEvent(java.lang.String title,
           java.lang.String seller,
           int numTickets,
           double price)
        This method is responsible for validating and executing the creation of tickets for sale. Validates that the number of tickets for sale does not exceed 100 and the selling price of the ticket does not exceed 999.99.
        Parameters:
        title - a string that represents the name of the xstreambackend.Event
        seller - a string that represents the name of the xstreambackend.User who is selling the tickets
        numTickets - an integer representing the number of tickets for sale
        price - a double that represents the price of a ticket
        Returns:
        0 on success, 1 on failure, 2 on InvalidNumTicketsError, 3 on InvalidPriceError

      • deleteSellerEvents

        public int deleteSellerEvents(java.lang.String seller)
        This method is responsible for deleting all tickets for events by a seller, from the system. It searches the list for an event with the seller equal to the seller's name and deletes the event. Users with no tickets for sale will trigger a KeyNotFound error. This error needs to be caught and handled such that it does not raise and exit error.
        Parameters:
        seller - a string that represents the name of the seller
        Returns:
        0 on success, 1 on failure.

      • decode

        public int decode(java.lang.String line)
        This method overrides the super class xstreambackend.Data's decode. It accepts the line of text and extracts the backend.data to create a event and insert it into the events map. The format for the backend.data extraction is: Start(col#) Size xstreambackend.Event: attribute 0 20 title 21 15 seller 37 3 numTickets 41 6 price Â 
        Overrides:
        decode in class Data
        Parameters:
        line - a string the represents a line of text from a file
        Returns:
        0 on success, 1 on failure.

      • encode

        public java.lang.String encode()
        This method overrides the super class xstreambackend.Data's encode. It is responsible for calling the next event from the eventIterator and formatting the event attributes into a string.
        Overrides:
        encode in class Data
        Returns:
        a string that represents the event to be written to file
